page.title: 04ST. PETER AND ST. FELIX
page.content: The church at Kirby Hill is called St Peter and St Felix it used to be called St John the Baptist. Parts of the building date from the 11th Century, the nave seems to date from this time with a chancel added in the 12th Century,later a tower and aisles were built. One interesting feature of the church is a lepers squint. Six church wardens are chosen every six years, their names are put onto wax balls which are placed in a bowl of water in the parish chest. Every two years the chest is opened two wax balls are taken out the names inside are the wardens for the next two years.
